intro: Pecluma truncorum, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or white, with a distinctive spurred shape at the base. Pecluma truncorum is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its preference for bright, indirect light and moderate humidity.
